item.title: Warnings - For IDE Users ONLY!
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

Ever since I started using an IDE (Eclipse) two months ago I’ve noticed warnings can sometimes appear in the Problems tab and this kind of bothers me which then leads to me fixing the problem by sometimes using the automatic fixes the IDE offers. Would any of the following actually impact the output of the code at all:

[ul][li]Fixing the warnings, for example - changing this code:[/li][/ul]

if (Server.npcHandler.npcs[c.npcIndex] == null) {
				c.npcIndex = 0;
				break;
			}

To this:

			if (NPCHandler.npcs[c.npcIndex] == null) {
				c.npcIndex = 0;
				break;
			}

Which, changes the code to being access in a static way.

Would doing stuff like that actually change the way the code operates and if so, how? I know that removing warnings such as unused data types, imports, etc would not affect the code at all unless however you had another class that uses that data. Any feedback is welcomed, thanks.

Read full topic
